Experience working directly with developers to ensure the successfulimplementation of a design specifications Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Knowledge with web development is a plus.Functional Skills: Hands on experience in designing B2B and B2C applications Hands on experience in designing world-class websites Hands on experience in designing product packaging Ability to work in an Agile environmentJob Responsibilities: Create UI & UX design for the web and mobile applications Create clickable prototypes for the given design work Creating animations for the promotional videos Create digital content for the promotional videso Ensuring the application has followed standard design principle as designed Ensuring all the outside communications are gone through design principleguidelines Ensuring to create product packaging for B2C brand Ensuring to follow the best design thinking approach for the product, web andmobile app design Ensuring all the designs have gone through the peer review before given to theimplementation team Design and implement design principles in the applications Create marketing content design for the digital and traditional publishing media Should be able to estimate the timeline for the given task Foster communication and collaboration between different teams Proactively stay close to emerging tools and capabilities and own the suite oftools/capabilities Ensure that the work is in accordance with established professional standardsand remain abreast of emerging trends and best practices that can beincorporated into the function Supervise and monitor subordinates and their workings on a day-to-day basis,and supervise, coach and develop junior members of staff within the Applications Perform any ad-hoc tasks as requested by the Reporting ManagerBehavioural Skills: Good analytical and problem-solving abilities Good oral and written communication skills Excellent business acumen and interpersonal skills

Title: Software Engineering - Java Fullstack
Description: Commercial Banking serves global clients, including corporations, municipalities, financial institutions, and not-for-profit entities with annual revenues generally ranging in billions of dollars. Our Commercial Bankers serve these clients by operating in 14 of the 15 top U.S. major markets. Our professionals industry knowledge and experience combined with our dedicated service model, comprehensive solutions, and local expertise to make us the #1 commercial bank in our retail branch footprint. CB Platforms & Shared Services Technology supports Commercial Lending activities (Bi-Lateral or Multi-Lateral Loans) for multiple lines of businesses of JP Morgan Chase. Loan IQ is the primary Loan Accounting and Servicing Platform and Aurora is an in-house application supporting loan activities from origination and syndication, loan maintenance to secondary loan trading. This role is for an engineer is to work with the CB Platforms & Shared Services Technology team at JPMorgan, Bangalore office. As a member of the CB Platforms & Shared Services Technologyteam, you will be working on the build out of the Aurora, a multi-year strategic investment leveraging Agile and fortress architecture principles. You should bring strong communication and comprehension skills and experience working in an Agile environment with continuous integration and delivery. You should be able to apply your experience to identify the right path forward, execute the next steps and get work done as an individual or as a team or with management support. You should be able to collaborate and work effectively in a team and across teams. A successful individual will be a problem solver, bring in best practiceswithin theteam. Specifically the role requires you to: .Design, analyze, develop, test, debug, and model the system components necessary to produce potentially shippable product iterations with each sprint. .Deliver high quality code that complies with standards and satisfies architectural tests. .Perform pair programming and assist the team in supporting the application in all required environments. .Provide estimates for user stories utilizing planning poker. .Participate in product backlog prioritization, story mapping, and story splitting activities. .Prepare and lead sprint review meetings showcasing completed product backlog items to the product owner and subject matter experts. .Proactively look to develop and implement best practices across the entire project team, practicing continuous process improvement. .Collaborate face to face and virtually with the Product Owner, Operations and Technology partners around the world. Required Skills.Bachelors or Masters Degree - preferably in Computer Science .Minimum 6+ years of hands-on programming/application development experience utilizing JAVA/J2EE,Spring Boot, REST, Micro Services, Cloud Native, Agile, DevOps and TDD. .Excellent Core JAVA ( w/ Java8 Features )skills having deep experience in OOAD, Threads & Concurrency and Collections .2+ years of UX/UI experience utilizing JQuery, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Angular. .Experience working in Unix. .Strong experience utilizing standalone Spring Framework integration .Strong object oriented analysis and design skills (OOAD) .Good SQL/PL-SQL Skills (Oracle 12c Preferred) andHibernate/JPA Passionate about testing strategy, problem solving, learning new skills, sharing expertise and knowledge .Strong written and oral communication. .Good presentation and influential skills. .Proven ability to collaborate with global teams. .Experience working in Agile teams, ability to focus and grasp business concepts explained during PBRs. Desired SkillsExperience in Production support. Experience working in a financial services environment with good working knowledge of associated accounting principles Previous experience with loans business

employee experience and help drive people experience for our business including campaign assets, promotional materials, and product creative Partner with stakeholders / colleagues on design campaign for program launches and promotions Consistently raise the bar for creative development and execution Support your designs using insights including quantitative data and site metrics, segmentation, and feedback Ensure all projects are completed within identified timelines and budgets Develop conceptual detailed visual mockups to communicate high-level design strategies Provide and manage design documentation and specifications Maintain a set of design best practices and guidelines to reduce and minimize production efforts Managing incoming creative briefs and project requests, updating SOPs and guidelines, and procuring design tools and resourcesBasic Qualifications : 7+ years of experience in a Graphic Design or Visual Design role, either in-house or agency Mastery of the Adobe Creative Suite specifically InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop on Mac OS Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Visual Design, Visual Communications, or related 4+ years implementing design across print and digital including packaging, collateral, mobile, desktop, app, email, social, and web 4+ years of professional experience collaborating with creative and technical teams 4+ years of vendor management experiencePreferred Qualifications : Experience with post-production techniques and a working knowledge of the printing process Knowledge of product packaging, web architecture, usability, UX and UI software Proficiency in video creation Team Management experience

Title: Senior Front-End Engineer - AWS EMR
Description: DESCRIPTIONWant to change the world with Big Data and Analytics Come join us on the Amazon EMR team in Amazon Web Services!Amazon EMR is a web service which enables customers to run massive clusters with distributed big data frameworks like Apache Hadoop, Hive, Tez, Flink, Spark, Presto, HBase and more, with the ability to scale up and down as needed. We run large number of customer clusters, enabling processing on vast datasets.We are developing innovative ways for customers to interact with their data. You will be creating intuitive experiences for data scientists, data engineers and data analysts who build and run massive analytics and machine-learning applications. If you want to apply your skills against the hardest and most rewarding challenges, and redefine the experience of practitioners in analytics and machine learning, this opportunity is for you.We're looking for an experienced Web Development Engineer to build UI experiences for brand new EMR product offerings. You will build modern UI experiences using the latest front-end technologies.For more information:. AWS re:Invent 2017 Amazon EMR: https://www.youtube.com/watchv=1CAWf9VDgFM. AWS re:Invent 2017 Keynote - Andy Jassy: https://www.youtube.com/watchv=1IxDLeFQKPk. AWS Big Data Blog: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/big-data/. AWS EMR: https://aws.amazon.com/emr/Inclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.Mentorship & Career GrowthOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.Work/Life BalanceOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Responsibilities. Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture/design/working software solutions by working with PM, UX designers, and customers.. Code and test system components participate in code and design reviews.. Demonstrate ownership of end-to-end code quality, system tests, functional tests, and integration.. Partner/Collaborate across teams/roles to deliver results.. Be responsible for overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance.. Mentor other engineers, define the technical culture, and help grow the team.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS. 5+ years professional experience in front-end development.. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.. Experience with web application development technologies (e.g., JavaScript/TypeScript, NodeJS, React). Experience with modern programming languages (e.g., Java/C#/Ruby or equivalent).. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS. Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.. Solid system design and architecture experience.. Experience building scalable, distributed, front-end experiences. Experience developing software using modern frameworks such as Angular JS, React, Spring or Node. Deep hands-on technical expertise in full-stack development.. Ability to lead and focus a team of experienced engineers, leading them to a common technical goal.. Ability to resolve conflicts and technical disagreements while leading the team to the optimal solution. Passion for building new products in a fast paced, team-oriented environment.. Solid coding practices including good design documentation, unit testing, peer code reviews, and a preference for agile methods. Sharp analytical abilities, proven design skills, excellent communication skills. Experience using Amazon Web Services desirable. Passion for building a rich and innovative user experience. Demonstrable track record as an owner: someone who can take a concept and make it real.. A thirst for knowledge and continuous improvement.Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

Title: Technical Lead
Description: Job Description :Siemens founded the new business unit Siemens Advanta (formerly known as Siemens IoT Services) on April 1, 2019, with its headquarter in Munich, Germany. It has been crafted to unlock the digital future of its clients by offering end-to-end support on their outstanding digitalization journey. Siemens Advanta is a strategic advisor and a trusted implementation partner in digital transformation and industrial IoT with a global network of more than 8000 employees in 10 countries and 21 offices. Highly skilled and experienced specialists offer services that range from consulting to craft & prototyping to solution & implementation and operation - everything out of one hand! Before our software developers write even a single line of code, they have to understand what drives our customers. What is the environment What is the user story based on Implementation means - trying, testing, and improving outcomes until a final solution emerges. Knowledge means exchange - discussions with colleagues from all over the world. Join our Digitalization Technology and Services (DTS) team based in Bangalore. This is your role. What part will you play . Implements innovative Products and Solution Development processes and tools by utilizing his/her expertise in the field of responsibility. . Leads, develops and motivates a group of dedicated qualified employees and professionals to achieve the targets set. . 8 - 10 years experience on developing software solutions with various Application programming languages. . Proficient in Java/J2EE, Python, Data Modeling and Semantic Web. . Expert in UI skills like Angular 2 and above, Type Script, HTML, D3/React, node JS, CSS . Good in UX design added advantage . Strong Command of Database Concepts, NoSQL, SQL Queries, JDBC. . Cloud based application development experience . Strong understanding/expertise in building REST APIs/ Micro services architecture Understanding of Webserver, Load Balancer and deployment process / activities We've got quite a lot to offer. How about you . Experience in research and development processes (Software based solutions and products) in commercial topics in implementation of strategies . Experience in expert functions like Software Development / Architecture, Software Testing . Exposure to and working experience in the relevant Siemens sector domain (Industry, Energy, Healthcare, Infrastructure and Cities) required. . International experience with global projects and collaboration with intercultural team is preferred Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens. This role is in Bangalore, where you'll get the chance to work with teams impacting entire cities, countries - and the craft of things to come. We're Siemens. A collection of over 379,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality, and we encourage applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit and business need. Bring your curiosity and creativity and help us craft tomorrow. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow s reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds Find out more about Siemens Advanta at: https://www.siemens-advanta.com/careers Organization: Advanta Company: Siemens Technology and Services Private Limited Experience Level: Experienced Professional Job Type: Full-time

Title: Engineer Associate
Description: Position Overview Full-stack developer - AVP - KYC Coverage ConnectThe KYC Coverage Connect Programme has been initiated to implement CRM solutions for Front Office Sales, Coverage and Business Management users to enable them to efficiently and effectively know which clients they cover, initiate new client onboards, initiate regular client reviews and offboard clients as necessary with full audit history. The programme comprises two major systems, Know Your Client and Outreach Portal. Know Your Client is the critical build-out of a client relationship and client lifecycle management tool for senior Front Office users. The application is very new and therefore, in part greenfield, and the major pillars of the client lifecycle require build-out and further enhancement for the remainder of the year and beyond, namely:Client on-boarding - ability for front office users to request on-boarding of a client. Integration with and feedback to bank client reference data and middle-office/operational client lifecycle systems of the bank to complete Know Your Client procedures.Client off-boarding - ability for front office to initiate off-boarding of clients who are deemed to no longer be clients of the bank. Requests are the passed to systems further downstream for processing. Client reviews - obligation for front office users to review their clients on an on-going, periodic basis to determine whether they should remain clients of the bank. Additionally, obligation to review clients on an ad-hoc basis as the need arises, ie due to negative news about the client etc.Client accountable ownership - all clients of the bank must have accountable owners who are accountable for the risk of the client to the bank. The application provides the ability for front office users to attest to be the accountable owner of the client for the bank.UX - we require the build out of a refined user interface to allow for maximum clarity and efficiency of our stakeholders. We need to bring together disparate sets of data from different applications, including deal pipeline and Saleshome applications to create powerful and meaningful dashboards relating to our user's clients.The programme will also focus on the delivery of Outreach Portal, which enables Front Office to reach out to clients to obtain KYC documentation from clients and enable scheduled communications with clients. Title: Manager - UX
Description: Job Title: Manager - UX Location: ChennaiSummary:ADP have a vacancy for an experienced Manager - UX to work within a team producing our next generation Human Capital Management (HCM) and Payroll products. This exciting opportunity is to be part of a growing international network of UX Designers that report to the UK head office. Day to day the UX Designer will be based with one or more development scrum teams working closely with development and product colleagues. Previous experience of this working dynamic is an essential part of the role. The ideal candidate has significant commercial experience as a UX practitioner with a specific focus on research driven ideation and solution design. He or she is proficient and confident at sketching and explaining their thinking, throughout the design process. Mapping workflows, user journeys and communicating design intent are the key skills required. They have a keen eye for detail and are visually focused, but are not necessarily a visual designer. They are skilled in producing wireframes and prototypes, but also understand when more agile methods are appropriate too. This is not a primary research role but experience in conducting usability studies, contextual inquiry and user interviews would be desirable. Candidate Profile: 12+ years UX Design experience (with a portfolio to match) Demonstrable experience of insight based design, ideally as part of a scrum team Experience in a cross functional UX team, working with researchers and visual designers Highly proficient in user journey mapping, information architecture and communicating user flows to stakeholders Process focused with the ability to explain ideas and show your working Visual thinker, innovative nature and enquiring mind Comfortable and fluent communicator Good understanding of UI development approaches Experience of complex data visualization and information design Passion for User Experience and Innovation Desirable software skills -- Sketch, InVision, Axure All applications must be accompanied by a portfolio of recent work.Explore our COVID-19 page to understand how ADP is approaching safety, travel, the hiring interview process, and more.Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Title: Sr Product Manager
Description: Job Description :Job summaryWe are looking for a Senior Technical Product Manager to develop new features and functionality for the Amazon Dash Cart and other confidential projects.The Dash Cart allows shoppers to checkout without lines - you just place the items in the cart and the cart will take care of the rest. When you're done shopping, you leave the store through a designated dash lane. We charge the payment method in your Amazon account as you walk through the dash lane and send you a receipt. Designed and custom-built by Amazonians, our Dash Cart uses a variety of technologies including computer vision, sensor fusion, and advanced machine learning. Check it out at https://www.amazon.com/bie=UTF8&node=21289116011.Our goal is to be Earth's most customer centric company and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in computer vision, machine learning, distributed systems and hardware design. This person must be comfortable working in cross functional teams, have the ability to think on their feet, and deliver simple solutions to complex problems. You will tackle challenging situations every day and you'll have the opportunity to work with multiple technical teams at Amazon. You should be comfortable with a degree of ambiguity that's higher than most projects and relish the idea of solving problems. Along the way, we guarantee that you'll learn a ton, have fun and make a positive impact on many customers.Basic Qualifications :Bachelor's degree in related field5+ years of relevant product management experiencePreferred Qualifications :MBA or Masters in technical fieldExperience with personalization features, hardware products, and complex integrationsExperience in delivering tech innovation for grocery / food retail / consumer retail businessesExperience working/partnering with UX Designers and/or delivering simple UI/UX prototype solutionsExperience managing complex product development cycles and highly technical solutions

Title: Senior Software Engineer - UI
Description: Job Description :Senior Software Engineer Join our Future of IT (FOIT) team which is building products that enable flexible, cloud-based storage and advanced data management solutions. Dell is offering multi-cloud infrastructure that captures and secures the data control point by moving from data persistence and data processing to data activation.The FOIT Software Engineering team delivers next-generation software application enhancements and new products for a changing world. Working at the cutting edge, we design and develop software for platforms, peripherals, applications and diagnostics - all with the most advanced technologies, tools, software engineering methodologies and the collaboration of internal and external partners. This includes the latest GUI frameworks, Kubernetes environments, advanced DevOps toolchains, and continuous deployment.Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Senior Software Engineer on our Software Engineering team in Bangalore.As a Senior Software Engineer, you will drive efforts across design, development, validation, and dev-ops teams to accelerate product feature delivery to our customers. You will need to successfully deliver customer-facing functionality for well-defined features in a team environment and are expected to be familiar with state-of-the-art tools and processes and have excellent written and verbal communications skills. We don't work in silos here-you will understand the customer stories and have the opportunity to question and improve upon them.You will Build highly scalable UI/Web applications that are designed for high performance.Provide leadership on the best practices for UI/UX design & continually improve upon the usability aspects of the web application.Work with a diverse team of architects and engineers both within and across product teams to collaboratively build a cohesive architecturePossess a strong aptitude for exploring new technologies and understanding of how to apply them to new products, tools, and customer-facing support scenarios.Work with quality engineering leaders to define the acceptance criteria for product releases & Participate actively in design and code reviews.Demonstrate excellent collaboration and communication skills as you obtain requirements, build a detailed design, and deliver a high-quality implementation of your software solutions.Take the next step into your dream careerEvery Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here's what we are looking for with this role:Essential RequirementsExperience: 5+ Years of Software Development Experience in enterprise class web application projects.Hands-on experience in developing user interface applications with JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3.Hands-on experience in developing secure and scalable web applications using at least one of the following frameworks/libraries: React/Angular/Vue.Hands on experience in front-end state management libraries like Redux/Flux/MobX & Hands-on experience in developing REST APIs.Knowledge of working with one or more public cloud platforms (e.g. Microsoft Azure, GCP, AWS) & Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for Web & UI components.Desirable Requirements:Experience building applications with micro front-end architecture.Knowledge of dev-ops especially Jenkins, Kubernetes and Docker deployments &Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL DB's and time series databases.Here's our story now tell us yoursDell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We're proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.What's most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.We started with computers, but we didn't stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what's next in technology, starting today.You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 .Application closing date: 30 October 2022Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Title: Full Stack Java Developer - Software Engineer Associate
Description: As a member of our Software Engineering Group we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation & engineering practices. You will be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.Job Requirement:This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:. 3-8years of experience in software/application development using Java stack. Hands on experience and working proficiency in developmental tool sets.. Experience in UI development using React/Angular, and UI/UX concepts.. Experience in writing junit automated-test cases, CI/CD build/deployment using GIT, Jules.. Experience of working with Oracle/SQL-Server/MariaDB/Redshift/Athena would be handy.. Hands-on knowledge of AWS-cloud / Azure / Google cloud technologies would be an advantage.. Knowledge of data-visualization tools like Tableau / Qlik will be helpful.. Knowledge of Agile Framework - Scrum. Experience working in a cross-functional, collaborative team environment. Experience of working on high data volume processing applications (batch and/or real-time)Desired Qualifications:. BS/B-Tech/BE degree or equivalent experience. Knowledge of industry wide technology trends and best practices. Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals, and passionate about building an innovative cultureOur Corporate Technology team relies on smart, driven people like you to develop applications and provide tech support for all our corporate functions across our network. Your efforts will touch lives all over the financial spectrum and across all our divisions: Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and within the Corporate Administrative Office. You'll be part of a team specifically built to meet and exceed our evolving technology needs, as well as our technology controls agenda.When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity.We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation.If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer M/F/Disability/Veteran.

Title: Video Specialist
Description: Our PurposeWe work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion (https://www.mastercard.us/en-us/vision/who-we-are/diversity-inclusion.html) for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team - one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results. Job TitleVideo Specialist OverviewAI Garage is responsible for establishing Mastercard as an AI powerhouse. AI will be leveraged and implemented at scale within Mastercard providing a foundational, competitive advantage for the future. All internal processes, all products and services will be enabled by AI continuously advancing our value proposition, consumer experience, and efficiency. RoleBring in creative ideas, create product videos, corporate business videos, posters and other design collaterals as a part of Design and Communications team, working on design and marketing projects for Mastercard AI Garage. . Working with brand guidelines for a global brand of Mastercard. . Create at the intersection of business, design and emerging fields of AI and Fintech. All About You. Excellent video and audio editing capability . Experience in Motion graphics and Animation . Ability to work with brand and design guidelines . Excellent communication skills and willingness to learn new skills and softwares . Ability to multitask and incorporate constructive feedback in creative projects . Ability to work in group and collaborate on design and video projects Software Expertise: . Final Cut Pro or Adobe Premier Pro . Adobe After Effects, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Creative Suite Effectiveness . Effective at managing and validating assumptions with key stakeholders in compressed timeframes, without hampering development momentum . Capable of navigating a complex organization in a relentless pursuit of answers and clarity . Enthusiasm for Data Sciences embracing the creative application of AI techniques to improve an organization's effectiveness . Incredible attention to detail and focus instilling confidence without qualification in developed creatives Core Capabilities . Strong written and oral communication skills . Strong project management skills . Bachelor's degree required. Advanced degree in Design, or UI/UX, or other quantitative fields desirable . Some international travel required COVID-19 ConsiderationsWe value the safety of each member of our community because we know we're all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we've implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice. In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard. Corporate Security ResponsibilityAll activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must: Abide by Mastercard's security policies and practicesEnsure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessedReport any suspected information security violation or breach, andComplete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard's guidelines.

Description: Triumph 2.0  Virtual Career Fair: Tata AIA Life Insurance is hiring for Manager- IT Application through Triumph 2.0 - India's largest Diversity & Inclusion Career Fair, 23rd August to 26th August 2022. Expertise in technical documentations and presentations Location : State	Mumbai - ThaneJob Category	Information Technology Key Skills:Interpersonal skillsCommunication skillsCreative thinking skillsSupervising/Leadership skillsTeamwork SkillsInfluencing skillsRelationship Building skillsDecision making skills	8+ years application development of Angular , Cloud service, Java / J2EE, Oracle and Middleware technologies	5+ Life insurance industry experience.	Deep hands-on technical expertise in multiple technical domains	Contribute to the development and maintenance of business solution and application integration Architecture Guiding Principles. Detailed Job Description that should cover the Job Purpose, Responsibilities, Required & Preferred Qualifications, Mandatory & Good-to-have Skills :The role has overall responsibility of providing system solution for all business requirement of Life Insurance sales channels , Operations , Finance and other functions to meet the business objective. He should prepare technical solution design specification for all business requirements and handover to software development team for implementation. He should have connect with Indian insurance market and update with latest trends. Perform competitive analysis for of the development of software applications. The candidates are expected to have a good understanding of software technologies and helping insurance businesses implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators. The role needs the candidate to understand Insurance domain, mentor the team and collaborate with vendor IT teams to ensure architecture alignment, support project managers, application design, design reviews and sign off to ensure business solution to meet stated project delivery objectives.Support client engagement, product enhancements and new development by understanding business requirements, and performing competitive analysis for of the development of software applications.o	Deliver better user experience of the new / existing products which would benefits the clients and internal product line.o	Should identify, understand and define customer needs, objectives and business requirements, to design a solution that can best meet the Client's requirements and internal product line.o	Adequate knowledge on UI/UX mobile / web application.o	Possesses business operations capabilities combined with excellent technical, communication, presentation and client handling skills.o	Strong Inter-personal skills; ability to communicate clearly at all levels  Salary:	1400000 - 1800000 Lacs Open Positions / Vacancies:	10

Title: UI Engineer II
Description: Job Description :About the roleThe scale at which Flipkart operates and grows every year is a challenge for our systems hence UI is no different and we make sure our applications could handle that traffic. As a UI 2 developer at Flipkart, you will be responsible for leading the development of our consumer-facing website and web applications, including end-to-end ownership of the software. One of the key responsibilities of a senior engineer is to work collaboratively with backend developers and product owners to decompose UI/UX flow into actionable tasks and ensure timely feature delivery. What you'll do:Own and build next-generation web applications which are efficient, reusable front-end abstractions and systems. Explore and design lively and compelling consumer experiences. Ensure that all the assigned systems are performing to scale. Actively participate in design and code reviews to build robust applications and prototypes You will mentor junior engineers on design and proper coding practicesWhat you'll need:B.E/B.Tech or any other similar qualification with minimum of 3 years of experience in the below technology stack. Deep expertise in Javascript, HTML5, and CSS3 and knowledge in any one of frameworks like React, Angular, and Ember is a plus. Understanding of browser internals and a basic understanding of the network stack. Understanding of common design patterns followed in front-end projects. Basic awareness of application security practices and deployment techniques for front-end projects. Should have sound knowledge of computer science fundamentals like data structure, and object-oriented programming and possess excellent communication skills.

Title: Design Manager, CS L&TD Creative Services
Description: Job Description :Job summaryThe CS L&TD Creative Services team is seeking a highly talented Design Manager to lead the Creative Services IN Design Team. You are the right candidate for this job if:You have experience in UX/UI and visual design.You enjoying coaching and developing your team members.You have endless creativity and enjoy designing assets to meet stakeholder needs.This position is located in India. The candidate will have the option to work in a virtual, hybrid, or on-site model.Key job responsibilitiesCoach and develop team members.Deliver high quality creative products by insisting on high standards and attention to detail.Conduct design/UX workshops and daily team stand-ups.Track project progress to ensure commitments are met.Create comprehensive design packages for large global audiences.Collaborate with internal stakeholders (Product Managers, Learning Experience Designers, Program Managers) to develop graphic solutions that simplify complex ideas for diverse audiences.Work with management and stakeholders to drive design schedule.Own intake process to organize cross-team workflow.Present design solutions to business, design, and executive-level leadership.Support your design rationale using quantitative data, customer feedback, and usability findings and coach your team members to develop these skills.Be a vocal contributor to design practices in the org by helping build a community of practice and nurturing a thriving design culture.Deliver a positive stakeholder experience for all projects.Comply with all corporate and organizational brand and design standards.Create customer-centric designs that can be used across multiple content channels.Build digital assets for a library of graphics, icons and illustrations.Drive design process improvements to improve efficiency.A day in the lifeOn a typical day, the Design Manager will start the day by conducting a daily stand-up with their team. They will review team projects to ensure that they are on track and remove any barriers that are blocking progress. The Design Manager reviews design projects to ensure our high standards are being met. They will meet with stakeholders todetermine if their needs are being met. They collaborate with senior leadership to ensure the team's goals align with organizational goals. They coach and develop their team members in regular 1:1 meetings. They research design advancements and develop team mechanisms.About the teamThe L&TD Creative Services team is a group of 18 highly talented, multi-discipline design individuals located in the US, Scotland, Ireland, and India. Creative Services design pillars include: Instructional Design, Learning Experience Design, UX/UI Design, Visual Design, Video Design and Production, Learning Technology, and Marketing. Our stakeholders include CS Learning and Talent Development, WWCS Global Communications, ACES, and C2CS.Our team prioritizes diversity, equity, & inclusion so we design for all abilities. As Amazonians, we appreciate and adhere to our brand standards. We value empathy so we design backwards from the customer to deliver on their needs.Basic Qualifications :Bachelors degree in UX/UI or graphical design.A minimum of five years experience in a design role.Previous experience in leading a team of five or more design individuals.Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills.The ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organizationProficiency in UX/UI, graphic design, and motion design.Preferred Qualifications :The ability to make high-velocity decisions that are strategic in nature and critical for the business.Experience in gathering success metrics for a design team.Experience in building a standard work model for a design team.An available online design portfolio.Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud SuiteMastery of color, layout, aesthetics, and balance in print, web, and interactive designExperience in both print and digital media.

Title: Lead iOS Developer
Description: Are you a great leader Hands-on with coding Bring your expertise and leadership to MEGA's end-to-end encrypted iOS apps. MEGA The Privacy Company provides global services from its head office in New Zealand, and Salamanca, Spain. Built from the ground up with Privacy by Design, MEGA provides a range of end-to-end encrypted cloud storage and communications solutions for individuals and businesses. We launched in 2013, and have grown to a global team of over 100 who are motivated by cutting edge technology. Currently, MEGA supports more than 230 million registered users globally, with desktop and mobile apps across all popular platforms. We are looking for a Lead iOS Developer located in India. About the role In charge of a close-knit team, you'll help build world class features for our iOS platform. As the leader of the iOS team in the Philippines, you'll be expected to work autonomously and deliver project phases on-time and on-budget. Working within Swift and iOS frameworks, you'll use your solid understanding of MVVM and VIPER architectures to deliver best-in-class UI/UX standards for mobile technologies, alongside concurrency programming on iOS. We value our people as much as our work, so your leadership skills will be as developed as your tech skills. To build an inspiring and motivating work environment, you'll lead your team on planning, execution and the success of projects, contributing technical insights to the product roadmap and providing scalable architecture design for projects. Together, you and your team will strive for industry best practice in both technical solutions and work processes, ensuring the delivery of world-class performance and quality products. Part of a global team, you will report to the Engineering Manager, who is an inclusive, high performing leader. This is a remote role. About you An iOS expert with plenty of experience working on complex mobile apps, through which you've developed a good sense of code smell and are fully familiar with UI/UX standards for mobile technology. A problem-solver by nature, your keen eye for detail has earned you the title of perfectionist; you follow best practice and don't break discipline, even under pressure. You have: 	Strong communications skills. 	Proficiency in Swift and iOS frameworks. 	Knowledge of the latest technologies. 	Extensive experience in SOLID principles. 	Experienced in concurrency programming for iOS. 	Familiarity with IT security practices, encryption, certificate management, public key infrastructure and more. Experience with SwiftUI and Combine would make you an even more desirable candidate, but it is not a prerequisite. Ideally you also hold a tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related discipline. Genuinely passionate about helping others to improve, you're a motivating leader, naturally driven to mentor and champion. You use your own experience to lead by example showing strong initiative, drive and attention to detail. We will help you to achieve your goals by leveraging the latest libraries to improve your efficiency, and will give you the space to be an autonomous leader, with support on hand when you need it but otherwise free to work to your own rhythm, empowering you and your team to get into the flow state where the magic happens. What MEGA offers Along with the freedom of flexible working, continuous development and opportunities for future growth, you'll enjoy a competitive remuneration package compliant with Indian Law. This is a stable role within a secure industry, with the opportunity to work with passionate and experienced Engineers across the globe. We have great and responsive leadership, a fun, hardworking team and plenty of ongoing learning opportunities that mean you'll continue to grow with us.

Title: UX/UI Product Designer for Qatar.
Description: We, Nair Systems, are a QFC based, boutique leading edge technology consulting and professional services firm focusing on Digital Banking, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data & Data Analytics, Cyber Security, Blockchain and Cryptocurrency and Robotic Process Automation. Nair Systems is currently looking forv Senior UX/UI Product Designer for our Qatar operations with the following terms & conditions. Education:  Bachelors / Master degree in Information Technology Any certification in UI / UXSkills & Experience:SketchAdobe Creative Suite ( XD, Photoshop, illustration , After Effects )Figma ( Strong in Design System process)UI Interactions in Framer PlaygroundSVG AnimationsPrototyping in ProtoPieResponsibilities Strong design experience including UI interaction, UX and UI designStay up to date on current industry trends and market conditions.Highly proficient with Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, and other design tools, ideally you will have used animation tools such as PrincipleIn-depth understanding of user centered design principles and best practiceSet design requirements based on information from business & internal teams, user research.Modify and revise existing designs to meet changing customer preferences.Experience of collaborating with software / frontend developers.Analyze how a new design satisfies market needs.Coordinate with other design team members to ensure consistent and accurate communication.Terms and conditionsJoining time frame: 2 weeks (maximum 1 month) Should yoube interested in this opportunity, please send your latest resume in MS Word format at the earliest at [Confidential Information]

Title: Sr. Mgr, Software Development, Amazon Smart Vehicles
Description: DESCRIPTIONJob summaryDo you have a passion for Automotive Do you want to challenge the status quo of the in-car experience Do you want to take on very ambiguous problems If you answered yes to these questions, we have a dream job for you. Amazon Smart Vehicles is looking for a Senior Software Development Manager to join the team to help deliver core components of our Automotive solution. Come join us! As a technical leader, you will assemble and lead a diverse team of managers and engineers to build and deliver cutting-edge automotive experiences at scale. You will be working with an assorted set of stakeholders, both internally at Amazon, and with some of our most strategic Automotive OEM partners. You will influence the roadmap and technology decisions that will drive future products and features that directly affect our growth in this critical space. A successful candidate is a motivator and an experienced leader who can hire high-caliber engineers and collaborate across matrixed organizations, with the ability to influence senior leadership.Key job responsibilitiesWork with product management, marketing, and business development teams to build, deliver, and maintain technical products that delight our customers.Establish structures that enable your team to solve complex problems and deliver systems at scale.Work successfully with customers, leaders, and other engineering teams throughout the product lifecycle.Provide hands-on technical leadership to the team, strategic planning, goal setting/tracking, design reviews, and program prioritization.Advise senior and executive management.Manage team priorities, headcount projections, recruiting, and continuous performance evaluations.Hire, develop, and manage an organization to consistently deliver results. Assess team and individual performance and address both high and low performance.A day in the lifeAs a leader and manager of the team, you will be working with business partners, software development engineers, testers, and UI/UX designers to design, implement, test, launch, and maintain new automotive experiences for the car. You will have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define product features, drive system architecture, and spearhead the best-practices that enable a quality product. You will learn a variety of cutting-edge technologies, development processes, and develop well-rounded skills such as leadership, and effective project management. You will also be responsible for building a strong development team and developing career plans for the engineers reporting to you.BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field8+ years of relevant engineering experience in building frameworks and applications for Linux based embedded systems: C++, Java, or other object-oriented languages6+ years of experience managing people and working with engineers (mentoring, coaching, career planning and delivering)4+ years working with hardware and software platforms in any of the following OS's : Linux, QNX, AGL or AndroidPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSSenior Software Development Managers who have any of the following qualifications are particularly valuable to our team:8+ years of experience managing people (software development teams- mentoring, coaching, and career planning)5+ years of experience developing distributed scalable Cloud services and large datasets3+ years of experience in working with Android application development teams3+ years of experience in Linux application development (QT)Experience with scalable distributed systems and interfacing with cloud based servicesPassionate about learning new technologies.Self-directed, demonstrate leadership potential and a team player.Driven to provide the best customer experience via technology.Proven ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team.Excellent written and oral communication skills.Excellent problem solving skills.Ability to drive innovation.Automotive experience is a plus

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe's all about. We give everyone-from emerging artists to global brands-everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We're passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.We're on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!Position Summary: This is an exciting opportunity to join the Professional Services Operations team as we support a rapidly growing consulting organization. As a member of the PS Revenue Analytics team, the Business Analyst will play a key role in helping the business make informed decisions by presenting information in innovative ways. Specifically, this role will have an emphasis on using data visualization to present large amounts of information in ways that is easy to interpret and spot patterns, trends, and correlations. This role will also have a technical portion too using different tools and languages to access data in order to create visualizations. You are a good fit for this position if you are experienced with data visualization, passionate about good UI/UX, comfortable in a fast paced organization, and passionate about partnering with other engineers, analysts, and the business. We are using agile product development principles - iterating quickly while remaining flexible to the needs of the business - to stay focused on delivering value and unlocking growth for the Professional Services business.

Title: Sr. Product Designer (UI/UX)
Description: Work Location: WFH.What your average day would look like: Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process ows Experience in creating design system Aware of design process Design wireframes and prototypes Prepare and present rough draGs to internal teams and key stakeholders Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors and images Identify and troubleshoot UI/UX problems Conduct layout adjustments based on feedbackWhat you need to work with us: Portfolio of design use case projects in responsive web design/ mobile-android, ios Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g., Figma, Adobe XD, Invision, Photoshop) Motion design for UI animation will be a good to have skill Team spirit, strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders Good time-management skillsQualication and Experience Required: Proven 3-5 plus years of work experience as a UI/UX Designer B Design, BFA, BSc in Design, or relevant eld

Title: Product Owner, Client Documentation

&lsquostand up meeting with ITO.Attend fortnightly Sprint Planning and Sprint Review sessions.End to End UATWhere end to end UAT is required and not covered in-sprintPrepare Test cases for business usersCoordinate UAT including defects managementValidate all UAT evidences are captured or all test scenariosGo-Live SupportPrepare UVT Cases for business usersCoordinate UVT, validating all UVT introduction of defects in productionTraining, Communications, AdoptionEngage stakeholdersConduct assessment and confirm requirementsCreate training and communication plansCreate / update training and communication materialsExecute training and communicationPost go-live communication supportClose collaboration with ITO toEnsure full automated test coverage is completed to avoid inheriting any forums.GovernanceAdhere to all internal and external regulations.Regulatory and Business ConductDisplay exemplary conduct and live by the Group&rsquos Values and Code of Conduct.Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.Lead to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank&rsquos Conduct Principles: [Fair Outcomes for Clients Effective Financial Markets Financial Crime Compliance The Right Environment].Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.Exercise authorities delegated by the Board of Directors and act in accordance with Articles of Association.Key StakeholdersEffectively manage relevant business stakeholders across the end-to-end Client Lifecycle, including IMO, Relationship Managers, Product Teams, CET, GBO / CRC, CLM Ops, FM, Trade, Legal and GTM teamsCLDM Leads and change delivery teamsProject managers and Product OwnersGlobal Process OwnersIT delivery teamsORO and AuditOur Ideal CandidateKnowledge of CCIB Business processes and Operations.Experience in Client Documentation, Credit Fulfilment, CLM processes and systems.Demonstrated success and experience as PO / equivalent role in CCIB will be an added advantage.Effectively manages relevant business stakeholders across the end-to-end Client Lifecycle.Attention to detail and Data Quality Management.Excellent communication skills - oral, written and presentation.Ability to manage multiple deadlines and effectively prioritize.Knowledge of Agile methodology, Confluence, JIRA standards.Business development skills - streamlining procedures, processes, help optimise and improve ways of working.Prepare periodic status reporting as required for stakeholder requirements.Ensure all project documentation is managed and stored within the program governance standards.About Standard CharteredWe're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we doNever settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so wellBe better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long termIn line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locationsTime-off including annual, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 weeks maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimumFlexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patternsProactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills,global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkitsA continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learningBeing part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.Recruitment assessments - some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process. Visit our careers website

Title: Senior Android Developer - Remote (Kotlin)
Description: Looking for your next rewarding challenge Join the team developing MEGA's end-to-end encrypted Android apps. Android Engineers India MEGA The Privacy Company provides global services from its Head Office in New Zealand, and Salamanca, Spain. Built from the ground up with Privacy by Design, MEGA provides a range of end-to-end encrypted cloud storage and communications solutions for individuals and businesses. We launched in 2013, and have grown to a global team of over 100 who are motivated by cutting edge technology. Currently, MEGA supports more than 230 million registered users globally, with desktop and mobile apps across all popular platforms. We are looking for Android Engineers located in India, to work in remote roles. About the role As an Android engineer, you will be writing high quality code. You will also be participating in code reviews while contributing to engineering guidelines and best practices across our global development team. Part of a global team, you will report to the Android Team Lead, who is an inclusive, high performing leader. About you You enjoy building world-class products which are technically robust, while keeping your code clean and working to deadlines. You're not just okay with this  you openly enjoy the challenge. You're a perfectionist, disciplined, and you know how to work within established frameworks to achieve a best-in-class result. Working alongside designers, other engineers and our QA team, you will assist in the development and maintenance of applications for Android devices. Your primary focus will be developing Android applications and their integration with back-end services across MEGA. You have: 	Experience with Java and Kotlin. 	Knowledge of computer science foundations, including databases, networks, algorithms. 	A keen interest in UI/UX standards for mobile technologies. Ideally you also hold a tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related discipline. Your two or more years of Android Experience and your knowledge of modern mobile application architecture will enable you to further develop our already successful Android app.  What MEGA offers Along with the freedom of flexible working, continuous development and opportunities for future growth, you'll enjoy a competitive remuneration package that is compliant with Indian Law. This is a stable role within a secure industry, with the opportunity to work with passionate and experienced engineers across the globe. We have great and responsive leadership, a fun, hardworking team and plenty of ongoing learning opportunities that mean you'll continue to grow with us. MEGA will also consider assisting candidates who wish to relocate to New Zealand, where our head office is located.

Title: iOS Developer - Work from Home
Description: Looking for your next rewarding challenge Join the team developing MEGA's end-to-end encrypted iOS apps. iOS Engineers India MEGA The Privacy Company provides global services from its head office in New Zealand, and from Salamanca, Spain. Built from the ground up with Privacy by Design, MEGA provides a range of end-to-end encrypted cloud storage and communications solutions for individuals and businesses. We launched in 2013, and have grown to a global team of over 100 who are motivated by cutting-edge technology. Currently, MEGA supports more than 230 million registered users globally, with desktop and mobile apps across all popular platforms. We are looking for iOS Engineers located in India, working remotely. About the role As an iOS engineer, you will be writing high-quality code. You will also be participating in code reviews while contributing to engineering guidelines and best practices across our global development team. Part of a global team, you will report to the iOS Team Lead, who is an inclusive, high-performing leader. About you You enjoy building world-class products which are technically robust while keeping your code clean and working to a deadline. You're not just okay with this  you openly enjoy the challenge. You're a perfectionist, and disciplined, and you know how to work within established frameworks to achieve a best-in-class result. Working alongside designers, other engineers and our QA team, your primary focus will be developing iOS applications and their integration with back-end services across MEGA. You have: 	Experience with Swift & iOS frameworks. 	A drive to learn and work with the latest SwiftUI and Combine. 	An understanding of MVVM & VIPER architectures. 	Knowledge of concurrency programming on iOS. 	An understanding of UI/UX standards for mobile technologies. Ideally you also hold a tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related discipline. Your two or more years of iOS experience and your knowledge of modern mobile application architecture will enable you to further develop our already successful iOS app.  What MEGA offers Along with the freedom of flexible working, continuous development and opportunities for future growth, you'll enjoy a competitive remuneration package that is compliant with Indian Law. This is a stable role within a secure industry, with the opportunity to work with passionate and experienced engineers across the globe. We have great and responsive leadership, a fun, hardworking team and plenty of ongoing learning opportunities that mean you'll continue to grow with us.

Title: Senior Writer (Web)
